title: Logos nets $50 million to advance plans for more than 4,000 broadband satellites
summary:
Logos Space Services has raised $50 million to advance engineering plans for more than 4,000 broadband satellites, the startup founded by a former Google executive and NASA project manager announced June 12.
The post Logos nets $50 million to advance plans for more than 4,000 broadband satellites appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: NASA indefinitely delays private astronaut mission, citing air leak in Russian module
summary:
NASA and Axiom Space are indefinitely delaying a private astronaut mission to the International Space Station because of an air leak in a Russian module.
The post NASA indefinitely delays private astronaut mission, citing air leak in Russian module appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: NASA’s SLS Rocket: Booster Separation Motors
summary: NASA’s SLS (Space Launch System) solid rocket boosters are the largest, most powerful solid propellant boosters to ever fly. Standing 17 stories tall and burning approximately six tons of propellant every second, each booster generates 3.6 million pounds of a thrust for a total of 7.2 million pounds: more thrust than 14 four-engine jumbo commercial […]

title: The Exploration Company Launches Mission Possible Recovery Vessel
summary:
European space logistics startup The Exploration Company has announced that its recovery vessel, Makushin Bay, departed Dutch Harbor, Alaska, on 10 June. The vessel will be used to recover the company’s Mission Possible demonstrator capsule from the Pacific following its return from space. Founded in 2021, The Exploration Company is developing a space capsule called […]

title: Far Out
summary: Pismis 24, the star cluster seen here in an image released on Dec. 11, 2006, lies within the much larger emission nebula called NGC 6357, located about 8,000 light-years from Earth. title: NASA’s Hurricane Science, Tech, Data Help American Communities
summary: With hurricane season underway, NASA is gearing up to produce cutting-edge research to bolster the nation’s readiness and response to severe weather.

title: NASA Sensor on Space Station Eyes Contamination off California Coast
summary: Proof-of-concept results from the mouth of the Tijuana River in San Diego County show how an instrument called EMIT could aid wastewater detection. An instrument built at NASA’s Jet Propulsion Laboratory  to map minerals on Earth is now revealing clues about water quality. title: NASA, Museum to Launch Junior Pilot School for Young Innovators
summary: A new generation of aerospace explorers will soon embark on a hands-on summer experience focusing on careers in science, mathematics, engineering, and technology (STEM). This month, NASA’s Armstrong Flight Research Center in Edwards, California, and the Flight Test Museum Foundation will launch the 2025 Junior Test Pilot School. title: NASA Launching Rockets Into Radio-Disrupting Clouds
summary: NASA is launching rockets from a remote Pacific island to study mysterious, high-altitude cloud-like structures that can disrupt critical communication systems. The mission, called Sporadic-E ElectroDynamics, or SEED, opens its three-week launch window from Kwajalein Atoll in the Marshall Islands on Friday, June 13. The atmospheric features SEED is studying are known as Sporadic-E layers, […]
